learning_outcomes.description: Explain the physical principles and biological effects of MRI electromagnetic fields, including the static field (B₀), RF field (B₁), and gradient fields, and their implications for patient and staff safety.

Apply MRI safety screening and risk-assessment procedures to determine patient eligibility for MRI, including the evaluation of implants, pregnancy, foreign bodies, tattoos, and prior surgical history.

Interpret and apply international MRI device labelling standards (MR Safe, MR Conditional, MR Unsafe) and manufacturer specifications to make evidence-based decisions for scanning patients with implants and medical devices.
Implement safe MRI operational practices in relation to magnet siting, access control, zoning, emergency procedures, quench events, and cryogen hazards.
Safely manage gadolinium-based contrast agents, including agent selection, dose administration, recognition of adverse reactions, and management of gadolinium retention risks.
Perform and interpret physiological monitoring in the MRI environment

Demonstrate professional and legal accountability in MRI practice by applying institutional policies, regulatory frameworks, and the roles of MRI safety personnel to ensure patient, staff, and facility safety.

assessments.task_description:
Assignment one is a MRI safety report/list of recommendations. Further details will be on blackboard.

Your paper should aim to be 2000 words (strictly limited to 1800 - 2200 words)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of assignments by EMAIL will NOT BE ACCEPTED.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This is a literature review on a MRI safety related topic. Your paper should aim to be 3000 words (strictly limited to 2800 - 3200 words)

Referencing

Variation in referencing styles exist in journals relevant to MRI science; therefore, we do not specify a particular style but prefer the use of either the Vancouver or Harvard referencing style. Both styles are attached. Click on the link to get access to ﾠUQ referencing style guides
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of assignments by EMAIL will NOT BE ACCEPTED.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The End of Semester Examination will be an in-person, paper-based exam for all students.

Internally enrolled students

The end-of-semester exam will be an in-person, paper-based exam. Students will sit the exam at the St Lucia Campus.

Externally enrolled students

The end-of-semester exam will be an in-person, paper-based exam. UQ Examinations will contact students directly to confirm arrangements. You will either sit the exam at the St Lucia campus (if you live within 200km radius of the campus) or will be directed to nominate an exam centre by a certain date. 

Please ensure you update your semester address in Si-net at the start of the semester.

One reminder will be sent and students who fail to nominate an exam centre and will be automatically assigned to the St Lucia campus. Late nominations will not be accepted. 

A list of examination centres is listed here, but note that Exam centre availability is subject to change at short notice.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
